intro: Orchis signifera, commonly known as the showy orchid, is a species of orchid native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and striking violet or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in woodland habitats and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are composed of three sepals and three petals, with the lip being distinctive and often more prominent. Orchis signifera is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
